basics.name: Tim Jacobs
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Passionate software engineer focused on architecture and automated software testing. I have extensive root cause analysis experience and deliver precise DevOps solutions. I optimize processes and make data driven decisions by focusing on what really matters - customer satisfaction, the bottom line and exceptional quality.

highlights: Designed, developed and delivered test architecture for event driven billing service
Implemented continual delivery for multiple microservices based architectures
Designed and developed dozens of shared components for multiple teams
Developed and implemented test architecture for microservices in golang and python using AWS services
Operational data team lead
Designed and implemented reference data re-architecture, moving mean commit to deploy time from weeks to hours

work.summary: Test Lead, Product Owner, DevOps transformation contributor
highlights: Designed test result reporting database, led team that brought service into production automating report generation for management
Assisted DevOps efforts - worked with team members to reduce build failure rate by 50%
Planned, automated and triaged tests helping enable on-schedule feature delivery for 100% of features I led
Product owner supporting a remote team of 12 engineers in Bangalore
Contributed to design and development of new test framework enabling transition of 1000s of test cases from legacy framework to containerized CI driven test framework
Reduced by 6x the resource requirements of legacy test suites by refactoring in two weeks

work.summary: 4 Direct reports as supervisor supporting 4 OEMs
highlights: Enterprise and data center SAS/SATA SSD Qualification team supervisor supporting 4 products across 4 Tier 1 OEMs with 4 engineers
Designed, implemented, and deployed qualification test status and statistic database with test script integration automating reports for management
Rewrote automation client to satisfy compatibility teams requirements, reducing automation deployment schedule by 20 months, improving test execution and reporting efficiency by orders of magnitude
Personally executed OEM qualification, integration, and maintenance release validation with continuous debug, root cause, and issue resolution enabling >60M/qtr in revenue
Supported OEM qualification by debugging to root cause hundreds of test script failures on a bi-weekly cadence to support release schedules
Developed automated failure analysis debug scripts for FW team to reduce debug overhead by 30%.
Compiled MTTF, MTBF data on failure modes to enable program management,quality, and reliability teams to make data driven decisions supporting release schedules
Championed test execution efficiency effort more than doubling validation coverage

work.summary: Automated previously manual work control document production
highlights: Built instrument, material, schedule and design verification database with web interface and automated work control document production reducing field rework from dozens of engineer hours per week to zero
Completed design and created procurement package for project InformationTechnology systems
Reviewed instrumentation and controls designs, developed work packages and work control materials for electrical, instrumentation and controls installation and testing
Supported product transfer from development in Longmont to production in Wuxi, China as failure analysis lead
Delivered Seagateâ€™s first 7200 RPM mobile drive to production volumes at > 90 %yields
Supported firmware selftest and manufacturing test with daily test performance and failure analysis feedback to cross functional core team
Tested a prototype automotive hard drive across environmental extremes for performance and reliability

interests.name: Machine Learning
keywords: design and test neural networks to predict the outcome of football and NCAA basketball games

interests.name: Gator wrestler, snake handler
keywords: Assistant handler of Alligators and Venomous Snakes at Reptile Gardens in Rapid City, SD. Extensive public speaking, not risk averse but very risk aware.
